Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: big red
Reviews.Content: The delivery was timely.The camera itself was excellent - solid with a heavy aluminum shell.The support bracket is OK for locations that there is not a risk of tampering, but a more heavy duty one is needed if it is in reach.For 640x480 the image is excellent -in day light it is first rate, and in pitch black it is excellent.Software is stable and has good functionality .Superb value - it is essentially a Foscam in a beefier body.BUT - it was advertised as a 67degree angle view - the sample I got clearly did not have 67Degs (I do have suitable references, and it is not 67deg)Would have been 5, except for the factual error on the lens view angle.

Reviews.Title: Seems OK, but Only Worked for a Short Time
Reviews.Author: Mr Plow
Reviews.Content: Purchased "Agasio A612-POE Outdoor IP Camera with Power Over Ethernet (POE), IR-Cut Off Filter for TRUE COLOR Images, 20 Meter Night Vision, Motion Detection Email & FTP Alarm, 6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - Silver" with a "TP-Link TL-SF1008P 8-Port 10/100M Desktop PoE Switch".  Both arrived quickly in good shape.  Really liked the quality of the camera construction - solid, tightly sealed.  What I didn't know before purchasing was 1) a 120VAC/DC power adapter was included (i.e. don't necessiarly have to use POE) and 2) that there is a single cable out of the back of the camera about 2-3' long that expands into 3 things at the end: an ethernet plug, a power adapter plug, and a little button for camera reset (none of these are weatherproof).  If you don't have a sheltered place 2-3 feet from camera, then the power/ ethernet cable connections will be exposed to the elements (although you could probably tape/ seal the connections).  I wanted to first check out and verify operation of the camera before going to all the trouble to set it up/ route cables outside (good thing).  So I installed the included software ("IP Camera Tool" on Windows Vista PC (dedicated to Blue Iris/ monitoring of 6 other older TrendNet cameras), connected the new Agasio camera to its power adapter and the ethernet to a non-POE switch.  Software found the Agasio camera right away, had it working in no time - for simplicity I then only changed the camera to a fixed IP address, then added camera in Blue Iris, no problem, worked right away.  Unplugged camera from power adapter and ethernet, powered up TP-Link POE Switch, plugged camera into one of the four POE ports (plus connected non-POE port into my other switch), Agasio camera powered up right away and continued to operate fine in Blue Iris.  Left it to operate awhile to 'burn in'.  After about half an hour everything died.  POE switch lights flashed indicating power overload on that port (only the camera was connected, no other POE devices).  Disconnected/ reconnected POE ethernet to camera, same problem repeated, camera unresponsive.  Completly disconnected camera from POE switch, restored connections as in 1st test (power from adapter, non-POE ethernet).  Camera didn't respond.  Did factory reset, included software ("IP Camera Tool") couldn't find camera.  Repeated a few times, same thing.  Powered off 24 hrs, camera never came back.  Returned both camera and POE Switch to Amazon (they paid shipping, this is the reason I buy from Amazon, Thanks Amazon).

Reviews.Title: RJ45 port on camera isn't waterproof
Reviews.Author: Irvin Kanode
Reviews.Content: The camera worked fine for a week and then became intermittent, then failed.  I tried swapping out POE injectors then the cable and that didn't help.  I discovered that the port on the camera for the network cable isn't water proof and the contact wires inside the camera were corroded.I ordered this to replace a Panasonic BL-C140A  that had failed after several years of outdoor use.  The Panasonic has a higher quality picture: better color, better able to handle contrast, better able to handle low light.  But the Panasonic doesn't have IR and isn't rated for full exposure to the weather.There aren't any instructions for the mounting hardware or even a picture.  The two flat pieces are meant to be assembled parallel to each other with the spherical ends of the mounting rods sandwiched between them.

Reviews.Title: Agasio Camera A612-poe
Reviews.Author: Bill Dunn
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the most bang for your money in video security around your home . This camera is it ! We have two full acres covered with remarkable clarity. Night vision ,day vision, motion detection and wireless convenience. We needed the ability to video for protection our live stock and family. Within days of installation we were able to remove a threat of a hungry coyote. We are able to I.D. Home delivery vehicles and uninvited visitors with remarkable detail. Want a Licence Number ? You got it !

Reviews.Title: Decent for the price...
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: "Camera is better than the old foscam with no irfilter and purple trees, at least the colors are right and no adjustment necessary from daylight to dark..."

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: So far the camera works well. Powered up fine with PoE. Image quality is decent (better than expected). The web interface looks pretty nice, however I will not be using it. I prefer to use zoneminder as I have other cameras and it's nice to have a central management interface. Camera took 3 minutes to configure with zoneminder. It was very simple. For outdoor use make sure you put your connector in one of those small outdoor electrical boxes and still wrap electrical tape around the connections. The build quality seems good. I have only had the camera for a short period of time. I will update as time passes (if i forget remind me). I will be purchasing about two more of these cameras with expectation of buying even more down the road. I highly recommend wired cameras over wireless. The only time you should use wireless is if you can not run cable.My Zoneminder configuration:Remote Host Name: IP_ADDRESS_GOES_HERERemote Host Path: [...]I did not try the settings with the default blank password. not sure if it would work (maybe remove pwd field). Just go to included web interface and change the password to something.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Will H
Reviews.Content: Good luck finding a comparable camera in this price range.I have 3 of these mounted under eaves outside of my house.  All running fine so far for the past month.  There are occasional watchdog timeouts from a network perspective (about 6 per day per camera), but I cannot be sure that is due to the cameras and not my POE switch or poor watchdog configuration.Pros: Good construction, good low-profile mount included, standard Foscam-like firmware, amazing value.Cons: Not a 67 degree viewing angle (about 53 degrees from my measurements diagonal, or 40 degrees horizontal), poor mounting anchors (I just used screws, but recommend using better anchors if you're going into drywall), cable lead is tough to work with (I would have preferred just an Ethernet jack on the back; I'll add a picture of one mounted).Update 2013-4-26:  After 8 months, they are still working well for the most part.  I've never had to adjust the mounts--glad they've held firm.  I had to RMA one when the IR filter stopped cutting off (so no night vision).  The standard RMA process went smoothly.  I don't expect any outdoor electronics to last forever.  As these eventually die out over the years, hopefully POE HD camera prices will have come down a bit.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price - Firefox on Linux no problem
Reviews.Author: R. D Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this primarily as a weather camera for our workplace. Note what the other reviewers state about the pigtail leads (and see the customer picture)--this camera is really 'weather-resistant' not 'weather-proof' as the pigtail connections should be made in a secure watertight box or run through to an interior room. Other than that, it appears to work fine. The webserver software running in the camera allows all the usual IP setups, and after changing the default webserver port and assigning a static IP a port-forward in the router was all it took to get Internet access. It's been up for a month now on PoE with no issues. The built-in webserver includes Internet Exploder, Server Push and VLC modes; tested and working fine with Windows 7 and with both Firefox and Chrome on my Gentoo Linux system. The software also includes a number of options for pushing images to an FTP server, email, and the like. Haven't tried those yet. Images are good both in daylight and on dark nights. All in all, I'm happy so far with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Pretty inexpensive and Works great
Reviews.Author: Joseph Vaccone
Reviews.Content: Great camera very Easy to configure Out of the box and price right!I priced some Linksys camera and that stuff is 4-5X a much with little benefits.If you are looking to protect your hose or business and you only need 3-4 camera, this is a great camera.I would figure that an IT guy would charge like $200-$500 to hook up 3-4 cameras. But you can do it yourself Easy.ProsThey are IP and you don;t have to mess with CCD Siamese Cable and CCD endsThey pick up and IP Address immediatelyThe picture looks really good just a little narrow viewOn detection of an intruder it will email you 6 Pictures through email. Gmail works <-very east to set upYou can also sent pictures to a Ftp site but gmail gives you 8 GIGs of storage freeThe cameras are individual and have their own operating systemThey come with power adapters but best used with POEConsAll Camera are all configured individuallyThe documentation is limitedThe Ethernet jack end is bulky and you would need to make a large hole if you want it located inside the building (approx 1 1/4 -1 1/2)  (If you keep the Ethernet jack outside you may be able to use some waterproof tape or caulk)They are not wirelessI think the metal base would rust it doesn't seem coated.Be sure to get a POE switch so you don't have to Use the power CordTRENDnet 8-Port 10/100Mbps PoE Switch (TPE-S80) OR  -- 8 PORTs Have POETRENDnet 8-Port 10/100Mbps PoE Switch (4x 10/100, 4x 10/100 PoE) TPE-S44  <-- ONLY 4 Ports have POE

Reviews.Title: Good enough, but not excellent
Reviews.Author: 2K1Toaster
Reviews.Content: The cameras are easy to setup and have a standard mounting connection so any of the 3rd party solutions should work. For setup, I just plugged it into a PoE enabled jack it blinked and connected to my network. From my router I saw what IP the DHCP assigned. Typed that into Firefox and the camera popped up. I setup a static IP and changed some of the brightness/contrast settings. Settings take about 30s to change except the immediate video effects like brightness/contrast/flipped/inverted.Once installed, they work well. In the daylight, they are relatively accurate in their colours, and their view angle is not wide, but wide enough. The resolution is only 640x480 and over a gigabit connection to a high end i7 server, they average 10-15 FPS at "very high" JPEG quality running through 60 meters of RJ45 cable, and 2 switches. At night, the included IR LEDs are almost useless. If they have something to reflect on, you can sort of make it out, otherwise it is pretty dark. This means insects and things set it off easily if you have motion detection, but it is also sensitive enough that if someone/something does pass infront of it, it will trip the record. You will at least have a record of the event, just not really enough detail to do anything about it.I currently have 3 of these cameras installed outside, and have had them installed for a few weeks now. Over these few weeks they have all worked continuously and perfectly except for 1 camera had 1 occasion it flickered out for a good 30 minutes. It was during a rainstorm and afterwards I noticed the RJ45 connection on the camera was drooping lower than my roofline. My guess is that it got wet. After it dried, it turned back on, retained all settings, and has continued like a champ.I just purchased 4 more of these because they make great wide coverage cameras. Cheap enough that they let you know what's going on everywhere. I have also ordered a true 1080p PoE camera to replace one of these on the main access point to the house. The high definition cameras will capture the detail you need, these little cheap cameras will let you know grossly what happened and to start recording from the good cameras!For less than $90 these are great value for money. If you want HD cameras, you are looking at twice that at least for anything of reasonable quality. Make your choice to have 1 good camera or 2 OK cameras if on a budget. My choice was many OK cameras and a very select few excellent cameras.My expectations for this camera were very low, and gladly it surpassed them and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality. I do feel that the connectors on the pigtail will be the downfall of these cameras. They are not waterproof or even weatherproof. There is no easy way to secure them, and the RJ45 jack which in power over ethernet cases supplies both power and data is extremely exposed. I am currently thinking of putting the connectors and wiring through a sealed outdoor rated PVC electrical junction box. Get the small ones for a few dollars at a home improvement store, they are gray, and they can be mounted near the camera and shove the wires inside. That`s the current plan but it didn`t stop me from ordering 4 more.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: James Hite
Reviews.Content: This was one of my first camera purchases.  I presumed poe (power over ethernet) was my best selection.  After purchasing some wireless cameras, I recommend those over the poe.  Also, I have to recommend Foscam over Agasio.  The camera admin interface with Agasio gave me issues I couldn't overcome.  I wanted the ability to save images/video on ftp.  Trying every combination of settings, the Agasio would not connect to the ftp.  Foscam connected immediately.  I even tried the exact settings from the Foscam back to the Agasio.  No success.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: SE
Reviews.Content: I have not had this camera out in the weather long enough to know if it lasts long in weather.  The camera works well and I have had no problems with it.  The housing is well made and fits tight.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Abid
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera in my multi-ip camera home surveillance system (using one right now, panasonic for the others).  At close distances, the night vision is quite good.  The install is quite easy, and it uses standard poe protocol.  So, you can use the poe switches for more cameras.  The only negative is that is is quite big, and the wire dongle hanging out of it is quite long (oddly includes local power adapter connection and reset button).  I snaked the dongle into the soffit of the home, so this camera excels for those installations.  otherwise, this camera is rock solid and for less than 100 bucks, it is a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Pet lover "xxxx"
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd such camera we have purchased. A 602 and now 2 612s. They are excellent for low light and high contract areas. The POE feature is a real advantage especially for an outdoor camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Richie
Reviews.Content: My company ordered 12 camera's for a new project. The were inepensive and I like the POE, the software is a little odd so once I got the IP address for the camera it was easier to use a browser and configure the device directly... Would be nice to be able to zoom but for $100 you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: Gets it wrong in all the details
Reviews.Author: Andrew J. Valencia
Reviews.Content: The A612 gives a good first impression, in its nice shiny aluminum casing.  I hooked it up to my (POE-injected) ethernet and soon had the camera in operation.  I have come to realize that after this much of the product's use, the company lost interest.The image is blurry.  If you rotate the camera around you can get different amounts of bluriness--there's something loose inside.  A quick search showed that this is very, very common with this camera.The IR illumination is minimal; it peters out after about 8 feet.  Similarly, the "motion detection" on its most sensitive setting will only trip if you put your face in front of the lens or drive a car right by it.  Between these two aspects, I've concluded that product development happened exclusively in a small cubicle somewhere.  For real use, looking out onto a driveway, this camera will simply not hack it.And yes, it really is a "weather proof" camera with completely exposed ethernet, reset button, and alarm I/O ports.  For my use it's in under an overhang so this isn't fatal.  But I do wonder about problems from moisture in the long run.Back to that blurriness.  There's a "support" e-mail address, which is never answered.  And there's a "support" phone number which is never answered, although you're endlessly exhorted to "please hold" by their phone system.  Did they forget to hire somebody to work the phone queue?  It's a toll call, not an 800 number, thank heavens I have free long distance.I'm sending it back.  Save yourself the hassle and don't order it in the first place.UPDATE 12/19/2012After three days of trying, somebody answered the phone!  He didn't do support, but scheduled somebody to call me back, which they did.  This person was pleasant, but simply verified that there is no focus adjustment possible on this model, so I should just return it if the image is blurry.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: S. LLOYD "Glastarguy"
Reviews.Content: Very easy install and it is working well.  I have it located several hundred feed away from the house using a NanoStation M5 wireless bridge.  I already had a DDNS service, so was able to add this IP POE camera to the existing service.  I can view live shots remotely via a mobile, tablet or PC and the night vision capability is OK as well.The documentation is less than optimal.  Nowhere did it give any specs on POE as the "manual" is written for three different Agasio cameras and they don't cover POE anywhere.  I used a 24V injector and it works fine.The hardest part was configuring my router for DDNS.  Luckily, I already had a DDNS Lorex camera system installed and I just used it's settings as a template with a different port number.The pigtail is huge.  It needs about a 1" hole cut in the wall to get it through, or run an ethernet cable through the wall and secure the pigtail connector in a weatherproof box.  Mine is mounted up high under an eave so a 1" hole fille in with silicone is no big deal.Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: P. Haines
Reviews.Content: needed to stop my theifs from robbing everything. put in 17 of these camerasaround my place. have not had a break in since. fair quality of picture, easy to program. suggest blue iris software for camera managment after deployment.

Reviews.Title: Price ok, support non existant
Reviews.Author: Paul B "PaulB"
Reviews.Content: Despite the claims of the website there exists no link, webpage, forum, or email address to obtain support for this camera. Two hours of searching and I can't even find a firmware update page.The camera may be water "resistant" but the cable connections certainly are not. Do not use this camera outdoors unless you can keep the connections of the cables inside. Electrical tape didn't help seal it either. The little push button switch will short out the camera quick if left exposed to rain.

Reviews.Title: After a Little Work, These Cams are Acceptable
Reviews.Author: M. Ketteman
Reviews.Content: I received two of these from Amazon.  FTP will not connect, I have five other Foscams that do.  Sent two email to Agasio, no response.  I called their "tech support" and got a guy who knows nothing about the camera, he was clearly a contractor with little resources.  He finally told me I needed to update the firmware and someone would call me back in a day or two.  I will not hold my breath; he didn't ask for my phone number.  I checked the Agasio web site and there isn't an option for firmware downloads.Update:  Agasio isn't the fastest for getting back to you when you have problems, but they do and with their help and adding download updates to their support site, I've fixed most of the problems I was having; I'm adjusting the rating from 1 to 4 stars and writing the problems off to Agasio being very new.

Reviews.Title: Buy something else....
Reviews.Author: rsmith
Reviews.Content: Bought one A612-POE about 6 months ago, it is working fine. So, I bought a second unit, and this one is complete crap! Focus is off, as seen in other reviews. There is a white fade-out on the lower left 1/4 of the image, and a couple of white wash-out spots on the image (almost like reflected light from an off-screen source, but it is not, as I turned off ALL light sources and the camera was in total blackness).  The IR Cut-filter is NOT WORKING at all, even after trying all the "fixes" suggested in the forums (hard reboot, "blinding" the IR sensor with a flashlight, etc.)  This is definitely NOT an OUTDOOR-rated camera, as the Ethernet port, reset  button, and Power supply plug-in are ALL exposed. (I wrapped these in a plastic sleeve and duct-taped the sleeve closed.) Installation under the eaves of a house might work if you keep the cables up out of the weather.I got these due to the low price, but you DO get what you pay for here. It is a crap-shoot whether the unit you get will work or not. (Read the forums on the Agasio site!)I am returning this second unit, and spending a little extra for a "real" camera...

Reviews.Title: decent camera
Reviews.Author: ntsecrets "mcunning@yahoo.com"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 6 months now and haven't had any real problem with it.  It has held up fine and gives a great image for the price.  The IR cutoff works ok, although sometimes clicks on and off a few times if clouds are passing by near dawn/dusk.  I don't use the motion capture or alerts on it, I have it hooked to a synology surveillance station system and it works fine with it, which means it has been continuously streaming since I installed it.  It does come with some software/documentation but once plugged in and you figure out its ip address its pretty straight forward to set up.  Their website does have a lot of how-to docs.  I'm considering buying another based on my experience with this one.  Giving only 4 stars since the web ui is a little clunky, but camera wise its pretty solid.

Reviews.Title: Ordered 2 cameras, both going back for different reasons
Reviews.Author: SanFran
Reviews.Content: I purchased two A612-PoE cameras for a basic home security setup. The first camera I plugged in to the PoE injector and my Apple Airport Extreme Base Station was located immediately and I was able to configure it using the WebUI loaded onto the camera.I noticed that the image quality of the camera was not good: completely blurry for the entire left side and bottom corner, as if the lens is off-axis. It's clear for the rest of the field of view. [ as an aside, I'm a professional film editor and photographer, so I'm not confusing compression for blurry imagery ]I was thinking about returning this camera based on the focus issue alone... But when I connected the second camera I purchased to the same Cat5e cable that the working camera was originally connected to, it wouldn't even power on (neither the power/activity LED illuminate). Camera would turn on with supplied power adaptor, but I would not be using it this way. Switch the Cat5e cable back to Camera 1; back online immediately. I tried it on the second PoE injector, and the same problem. I'm confident it's not a cabling or Injector issue.So, back they both go. I think I'm going to spring for a more expensive camera.On the topic of exposure:With the working camera, I found the "night vision" to be actually very poor. Although they say the exposure auto-adjusts, I never was able to make it work over five days of testing. Our back yard has landscape lighting, and a nearby street light is bright enough to see where you're walking, but the camera only picked up the immediate areas around the lighting sources. If I were to crank up the brightness on the webUI, it would be better, but come morning, the picture was completely blown out. They say this camera's IR illumination works up to 20 meters (which, incidentally, is a full 10 meters beyond our property line), but I found it to only work for about 10 feet with any success (inside or out, hooked up to PoE or the provided power supply, as to eliminate a voltage issue).

Reviews.Title: POE does not work
Reviews.Author: Origtopcat
Reviews.Content: POE feature is not working. I get power using the supplied power adapter but the feature that i wanted was the POE and this has failed to meet my expectations

Reviews.Title: Great POE camera
Reviews.Author: ANRMWM
Reviews.Content: I bought this to monitor my woods, so I did not want to run power out there in addition to a network cable.  I also prefer the reliability of a cable over wireless any time it is possible to choose a cable over wireless.  And if I wanted a wireless camera, then I would have had to hassle with batteries or running power anyways.  I have it hooked up to a POE switch for power and network with the single cable.  It does come with a power adapter in case you don't have a POE switch.  I ran about the maximum of 330 feet for the cable run.  As other reviewers stated, the connectors are not water proof, so I just bought a water proof box, mounted it next to the camera and made all the connections in it, then sealed it with caulking.  It has been working in sub zero temperatures.  The resolution isn't wonderful, but the price is right for the resolution and the fact that it is POE.

Reviews.Title: PoE didn't work with my Linksys PoE switch
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "johnseat"
Reviews.Content: This camera seemed like a good deal but when I connected it to my PoE switch it did not work.  It would work with the included power supply but not over PoE.  I have 2 other PoE cameras and they both worked on the same cat5 cable so I know it was a problem with the camera itself.  For this reason I returned it for a refund

Reviews.Title: Didn't last long
Reviews.Author: Nicholas C. Lundmolfese "nclm"
Reviews.Content: Pretty much stopped working after using it outdoors for about 2 months.  Support page on the Agasio websites for camera is blank.

Reviews.Title: Good unit, decent value
Reviews.Author: J. Weaver
Reviews.Content: This unit's picture is good, not great.  Everything works as advertised, including the PoE and motion detection.  The motion detector makes an audible click.The color is not true due to the night vision.  The night vision works like you would expect.I bought this unit just to tinker with the technology and it is good enough and priced right for that purpose.  I have not had it outdoors, so I cannot vouch for how it will handle weather.The web interface for the unit is typical of all of these low-end IP cameras.  It functions just fine.  I am also using Blue Iris software to record video and it functions fine with it.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality, poor frame rate, failed night vision mode.
Reviews.Author: M. Feltz "airplanepilot"
Reviews.Content: The camera typically provides less than 3 frames per second under daytime lighting conditions and a 640 x 480 picture resolution.  Not impressed with this aspect of the camera!The night vision feature worked well for about three weeks then quit.  The IR LEDs glow a dim red which indicates that the camera's night vision  mode is active however the night picture is pure black.  I suspect the IR cut filter is stuck and cannot move out of the way when night vision mode is activated.The included camera mount is cheaply made and the included hex wrench does not properly fit the hex-head screws.  The mount is not long enough when attached to a wall to  permit the camera sufficient room to pivot to anything close to 90-degrees from the wall.  You are limited to pointing the camera along the wall rather than perpendicular to it.The only positive thing that I can say about this camera is that the weather-proof casing appears to be sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera - Lousy Software
Reviews.Author: J. Aguiar
Reviews.Content: After purchasing Trendnet and Foscam cameras, I decided to try this unknown brand.  Although the camera bears a striking similarity to Foscams outdoor camera, the software left me saddened.  The software is clunky and difficult to use.  After spending 30 minutes with the software, I finally discovered that you could not record the unit to anything but a local PC (no network storage).  This unit was sent back to Amazon and I will return to what works well.

Reviews.Title: Works flawlessly
Reviews.Author: C. Tinetti
Reviews.Content: Have this camera running (using PoE) 24/7 for 9 months so far.  Not a single hiccup with this baby.  Will buy another if needed.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Andrew "Andrew"
Reviews.Content: this are good in the day time, at night the range is very limited, but better then nothing, you can see a red glow from the IR lights at night, they work great with Blue Iris as well, they DO NOT have a speaker.I have not had them outside yet but i see no issues, the POE works great.

Reviews.Title: Works but don't expect high resolution
Reviews.Author: JG McClung
Reviews.Content: I've purchased several of these IP cameras.  This was my first from Agasio.  This one does not have the wireless option.  I use this one indoors connected directly to my router.  They work similar to the other cameras but they all have the typical washed out color due to the infrared response. The biggest problem for me is the low resolution but this has been typical of all these type of cameras.  Having said that they are very useful and provide the security I was wanting which is sending email when triggered by movement.  This can be done even with the computer off; just plug it into the wireless router and setup you email account.  If you want to have live view over the interned then you need to setup a DDNS server which is too lengthy to cover here but it works well and allows you see inside your home while you're away; and also allows control the camera settings.

Reviews.Title: POE Enthusiat
Reviews.Author: AmazonFan
Reviews.Content: ASIN:B005DOMNK8 Agasio A612-POE Outdoor IP Camera with Power Over Ethernet].  Pictures are great.  At night you can see clearly all the monitor areas unlike other trendnet cam.  It's easy to set it up.  I like the DDNS it's defaulted to and so easy to use.  The only thing that makes me to return this camera is that it requires the computer to be on and the camera IE to be on in order to record.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: technerd
Reviews.Content: Camera worked great.  An unbelievable product for the price.  However, I needed a dome POE for outdoor.  When they have this product, I will purchase 5 of them.  The fixed location one just wouldnt do for my house.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly versatile but tight angle
Reviews.Author: Travis Nave
Reviews.Content: The good:This camera is very sturdy.  It's heavy and metal and really feels like it can take years of abuse inside or out.  I originally bought it because it was PoE, but the fact that it also is WiFi has made me reconsider and just put it to AC power.  It's got great distance on the WiFi, picking up the signal in all corners of my house, where even my portable devices sometimes suffer.  It's got a large WiFi antennae that connects to it for this purpose.  And its night vision works incredibly well.  I love the fact that it can be set up to email you when motion is detected.  So even if you don't have a DVR, you can still have hard proof of intruders.  Setting it up to be viewed from my phone remotely was also a breeze.  When I am ready to expand, I will get another one of these.The bad:There's nothing really bad, per se.  My only complaint is that its field of view doesn't seem to be as wide as it could be.  Also, some of the emailed pictures have motion blur, so you might only get one or two good ones out of the half dozen or so it will send you.  Also, the wifi antenna and the power cord sometimes fight for space.  I originally broke my factory antenna, but as an IT professional, I had a couple extra laying around to replace it.

Reviews.Title: You get What you Pay for!!
Reviews.Author: jason butler
Reviews.Content: It was the cheapest POE camera that I could find and although it's easy to set up, the pictures are poor and the motion detection software goes off all day and night.  If your lookinig for an easy to use - inexpensive camera that is POE - This is the one for you - but buyer beware - there are far superior products for a little more money that are well worth investigating before buying this model.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful security camera!!!
Reviews.Author: briantrent
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch outdoor camera. If you want security from a high tech camera with amazing capabilities and great quality pictures, then this camera is for you! Between the power over ethernet function and the email notifications when motion is sensored this camera is wonderful. Also, definitely not a picture like most outdoor cameras. Very good pictures and video and even night vision. Being compatible with my new Iphone and being waterproof and sturdy are a plus also. I would definitely recommend this Agasio camera!

Reviews.Title: power over ethernet pretty useless on this cam
Reviews.Author: someoneSomewhere
Reviews.Content: I've purchased this camera for the built in power over ethernet capability. Sadly, the power adapter connects one foot away from the camera which defeats the purpose of poe. This camera needs to come with a poe adapter that feeds power at the router end. I'm sending it back..

Reviews.Title: AGASIO A602W (POE) - Avoid It.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Wandling
Reviews.Content: The camera is a waste of my time.The frame rate of the video is terrible - blurry - no good for a security camera which is what it's meant to do.The documentation is poor.  Yes, I know English isn't their first language.  They can still afford to have a technical writer revise it to make it somewhat coherent.The web site (http://agasio.com/download-firmware/)  doesn't offer firmware upgrade/updates.  Why?My firmware is 17.35.2.47.The ActiveX menu doesn't work.  The camera will get wedged and require a reboot (Hmm if only I could upgrade that firmware! or software in the camera)The best resolution is 640x480.  How did I miss this? Why did I buy this piece of junk?I'm sending the cameras (2) back and expecting a refund.  I'm disappointed with the quality of the camera, very blurry image when things move (they claim 30fps? no way), lack of clear documentation, lack of firmware updates oh and I saved the best for last:The Allen wrench they ship with the camera to adjust the base.  Ok.  The wrench is 1" x 3/8".  Right. Draw a rectangle 1" x 3/8" -- that's big enough to fit the Allen wrench they sent.The camera was purchased through Amazon.com (fulfilled by Amazon) from EpicVideo Seller.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: AM
Reviews.Content: Agasio A612_POE Outdoor IP Camera is very good camera has very good picture quality and very reliable I would recommend this to others as well. I was just facing small technical issue having remote access to this camera i contacted the technical support and spoke to Felix Anderson he was very quick in accessing my computer and setting up the camera for me.

Reviews.Title: Agasio Tech. Support
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: Calvin was very helpful in taking those weird human images off the cameras.  He is very knowledgeible.  It is very nice to work with.  The motion detection is what I'm looking for in the camera and I'm sure when they are installed on the outside the other images will disappear.  I think the camera's will resolve the stocker problem I'm having.  I purchased the camera from amazon.

Reviews.Title: BULL&@!%
Reviews.Author: S. Basile
Reviews.Content: NO AUDIO!!! NOT a 67 degree view. I never do reviews but this time I HAD to warn others. Half the features it has in the tools program is completely unavailable.  Not to meantion my computer began crashing shortly after I installed camera and got it online.  This was supposed to be the camera I bought and spent more $ on so that my home would have some surveilance at all times.  No instructions on how to view rom your smart phone either.  Never could figure that out cause after the third computer crash I yanked the connection the camer had and uninstalled all programs.  Completely let down.

Reviews.Title: Customer Support - Kate was outstanding
Reviews.Author: Gary Alguire
Reviews.Content: Was able to contact Customer Support after re-installing my server and they helped me out very quickly and did a great job!Thank you very much Kate!

Reviews.Title: Not really POE!!
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I thought this was a passive POE like the UBNT IP Cameras!!UBNT IP Cameras are good but they lack IR for night vision, so that is the reason why I bought this one, but unfortunately this camera is not Passive POE and on top of that, the mounting kit is horrible!!!

Reviews.Title: Recording did not work at all
Reviews.Author: Isaac G
Reviews.Content: Seems like a solid camera. The huge issue I had was I could not get it to record at all. It would send emails just fine but would not record. I tried the web ui via the active x control in internet explorer, the ip camera client, and a couple of 3rd party tools. It simply would not record. Called tech support and they just told me to get a replacement....contemplating what I am going to do at the moment...would like this camera a ton if it just worked as advertised...

Reviews.Title: Camera Support
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: I love the pan, night vision, flexibility of movement, etc.  Calvin Harris was excellent in helping me set up the cameras!

ProductInfo.Features:
Built in Power Over Ethernet capability (PoE - dc power supplied over 1 cable, no need for separate power and network cable)
IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images (not washed out) - 640x480 Resolution; 0.3 Megapixel
Supports M-JPEG video compression - 24 IR LEDs for night vision up to 20 Meters - Motion detection alerts via emailed images and FTP image upload
Supports DHCP, fixed/static IP and PPPOE - Multi-level user management and password protection - Allows for remote viewing and recording from anywhere in the world through the internet - Supports DDNS for dynamic IP address stabilization
Features an IP66 hardened outdoor waterproof enclosure; Provides for remote viewing & recording over the local network or the internet through a PC or mobile device (including Iphone, Android & Blackberry)
ProductInfo.Name: Agasio A612-POE Outdoor IP Camera with Power Over Ethernet
